page.title: 09Hornby-Village Institute
page.content: Hornby Village Trust runs the village institute.It was originally used as a reading room in the village. When the Village Trust wanted to expand and develop the room they approached the then owner of Hornby Castle if he would undertake to provide the village with enlarged facilities but he refused. The village raised the money and had the Institute built almost 50 years ago. The Institute has become the social centre of not only the village but the whole area. Many of the village societies and organisations meet there to hold social, educational and money raising events. Rooms in the Institute can be hired for private parties; about 80% of the money raised by the Village Trust is through lettings. Without the Institute, much of the social life of the village would disappear and the strong community ties would be reduced.
